intro: Paloue guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan paloue, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically large, palmately lobed, and have a rough texture. Paloue guianensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
